content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª I wonder how go-gopher actually renders gophermaps into html

@akoizumi@social.kyoko-project.wer.ee Yup it‚Äôs basically just this:

<pre>
{{range .Lines}} {{if .Link}}({{.Type}}) <a class="{{ .Type }}" href="{{.Link}}">{{.Text}}</a>{{else}}      {{.Text}}{{end}}
{{end}}</pre>

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª I wonder how go-gopher actually renders gophermaps into html

@akoizumi@social.kyoko-project.wer.ee It doesn‚Äôt, but gopherproxy does. It just uses a template and iterates over the gophermap

content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Through the years I tried many different search engine. And unfortunately except google no one has ever been as accurate. I'm trying again duckduckgo and I have not been disappointed so far.

For instance I kind of like what @mckinley linked to:

Marginalia Search is a search engine with their own crawler that prioritizes simple, readable websites.

I kind of want Spyda to be this‚Ä¶ And recent activities and discussions also made me realise there‚Äôs no reason Spyda couldn‚Äôt use chromedp as part of it‚Äôs ‚Äúscraping‚Äù as long as the content that comes back is in some way or another ‚Äúreasonable text‚Äù that can be indexed.

content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª ü•≥ NEW FEED: @phoronix

@Yarns@search.twtxt.net Who set this feed up? ü§î Anyone? ü§î

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @ocdtrekkie I bet it‚Äôs the ‚Äútypo transport protocol suite‚Äù ü•¥

@lyse@lyse.isobeef.org @movq@www.uninformativ.de @ocdtrekkie Oh my god!!! ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Bahahahaha üòÖ ü§£ üòÇ Man my typos are getting really bad üôÑ

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª First of all, I was debating whether to take part in this yarn or not. But, here we are. ;-) Second, I never used Gopher and I don't have any feelings about it, neither positive nor negative ones. I basically just acknowlege its existence. :-) And finally, except for @prologic I don't know anybody else in this mailing list discussion, met them all for the first time today.

@lyse@lyse.isobeef.org I guess the thing here is, all I wanted was to find out the ‚Äústate of affairs‚Äù really. Not to have some rant discussions about how bad Gopher + TLS is, etc. Oh well üòÖ ‚Äì

I‚Äôve actually learned about the state of ‚ÄúGopher + TLS‚Äù in this Yarn than on that mailing list thread ü§£ Hmmmm ü§î

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @abucci Interesting. ü§î

@movq@uninformativ.de

Still, I suspect that ‚Äústrong opinion‚Äù + ‚Äúnot a native speaker‚Äù is a bad combination. üòÖ And on top of that, we‚Äôre all communicating just through text, you can‚Äôt hear that persons voice nor see their face.

Yes you are right! üëå its one of the reasons I use Emojis quite a lot in my ‚Äútext‚Äù ü§ó To convey my mood and feeling somewhat‚Ä¶ Also I like them too üòÖ

Its hard to tell sometimes, but I still believe @abucci@anthony.buc.ci is/was right in that if the first two had not responded, the discussion might have actually been a useful and productive one. I left because it wasn‚Äôt üò¢ Life is too short, and as you know I have many things going on, time for ‚Äúhot debates‚Äù is not on my high list of priorities ü§£

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @movq idk, that sounds pretty hostile to me. The very first responses are to say "if there's TLS it's not gopher", and to post a rant against using TLS at all.

@abucci@anthony.buc.ci Thank you! üôè I‚Äôve had a couple of folks make me think I might have overreacted, but your reply reminds me that I did not. You‚Äôre absolutely spot on, the thread did get ‚Äúshot down‚Äù and the discussions (or lack thereof) did quickly become ‚Äúhostile‚Äù in my view. I really felt like I stirred up a hornets nest back there ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
